pullRequest.title: Implement Events used by Apathetic Mobs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Note: This is currently untested (other than "does it crash the game on startup/playing/shutdown singleplayer"), as Apathetic Mobs also requires #19 and the corresponding changes in patchwork-patcher. Once it has been tested (either through testmods or through real mods) it can be taken out of draft status.
I have a few comments/suggestions for reviewers, which I will add using the review feature.

nodes.bodyText: So, I ended up creating two separate possible mixins for this. I currently like the latter more, as I feel like it's more robust, but I'm leaving the former in for now, in case its actually better. I will remove whichever one isn't used before merging.

Question about injection location. I kinda feel like injecting into the HEAD of ServerWorld.close would be marginally better than MinecraftServer.shutdown, but this is where forge does it, and it's not difficult to inject it here.
I ended up creating some mixins to handle some DimensionManager patches. I can totally remove them from this PR, just figured I'd leave them in in case they'd be useful in the future.
Currently, there's a minor locational difference between this mixin and forge. I don't think it'll have any side-effects, other than maybe being a bit inefficient.

... oops, i forgot to add all of the new mixins here, which means that it's even less tested than I thought. sigh
I'll come back to this later. I've already been working on this for hours in a row today.

nodes.bodyText: INVOKE_ASSIGN is a built in injection point that just puts it after the INVOKE call, that seems like what you want. The name seems odd, but the real name is AfterInvoke as opposed to BeforeInvoke (INVOKE's internal name)
